Message.Title: Finally a good Motley Fool article
Message.Msg: Read the Motley Fool article recently released on Amazon's cash flow. Bezos has been touting cash flow, but Amazon isn't generating real cash flow. Rather, his is simply shortening the receivable cycle and extending the payable cycle, which works only so long as sales are increasing at a high clip. Once sales growth deteriorates, say to 10%, the cash flow dries up. You can only make money on financial gimics so long. At some point, you have to improve the retail business. This stock is so overvalued it isn't even funny. With retail giants like Target now starting to fight back with discounting, and Amazon having to collect sales tax, it gets a lot tougher from here for Amazon. As I've said before, I predict sales in California dropped 20% last quarter because of the new sales tax requirement put on Amazon. Could this be why Bezos just sold to $100M lots of stock?

Topic.Title: Finally a good Motley Fool article

Message.Msg: Well, BBY reported their online sales increased where AMZN collects sales tax.

Topic.Title: Hmmmmmm.... Wonder whats gonna haapen today?

Message.Msg: bond yields on the 10 yr are near 1.90 %, the upside limt area for the last year. Most of Bernake's Operation Twist buys are now underwater in this time frame. Normally, 1.90 % would seem low, however, when you are carrying close to $3 trillion of debt on the Fed balances sheet with increased duration due to Twist, going to from 1.56 % low ind Dec 2012 to 1.90 % now becomse a bigger deal, it's a rate hike on the long end. I suspect the Fed starts to pie hole this rate down be/c the losss holdings are growing. That's what they have done the past. It's essential that interest rate spikes stay lower and lower as their balance sheet bloats out with bigger and bigger balances due to QE. So I suspect we'll start to hear the yapping from them ot makes sure interest rates won't spke past this big resistance area and give them a big loss carry. We'll see you can pull up a 10 yr gov't yieild chart and see. What event gets them to lose control is not known at this time yet.

Topic.Title: Finally a good Motley Fool article

Message.Msg: Over the past 5 years (08-12) Amazon has generated $8.9B of Free Cash Flow. All of that (101%, $9.0B) has come from employee stock comp and from squeezing suppliers (extention of payables). The first dilutes the stock and second is not real cash generation, just temp stimulus. And Bezos wants us to focus on FCF?

Message.Title: Let's be reasonable
Message.Msg: Amzn realizes 90% of their revenues from their retail sales. The best they have ever done is 2.5% to 3.5% margins. So given their 2012 revenues at $14 billion with a generous margin of 4% results in eps of $1.24. Then say a low earth orbit p/e of 100 as opposed to their astronomical 3700, you get a share price of $124. Thats more than reasonable and far less than half their share price now. Lets face it, amzn is really worth no more than $50-$100 a share, if that much. There is a big correction coming in the future.

Topic.Title: p/e amazon 3000 or 300???

Message.Msg: Haha, nice try funny guy! Earnings are based on profits. Investments are not removed from earnings -- they are not a cost!

Topic.Title: p/e amazon 3000 or 300???

Message.Msg: What are they investing in? Warehouses that require labor? I thought this was an internet company? Ship everything from once central place, or one in each quadrant of the US, not centers 50 miles from each other. The Kindle is a loss leader and they led that market. The iPad mini has killed all profitability. Now they think they can go into the cellphone market...good luck...more losses. Margins keep getting worse as well as the balance sheet. I think they raised that $3 billion to make Spain (or was it France), Texas and all the other states due back taxes of $250 million + each. They won't get out of all those. Every company is judged on earnings. You are against saving cash? I guess Apple has the wrong business model. Bezos nows wants people to believe its cash flow that is important. Even if you judge them on that, they are still way overvalued. Last quarter was bad and on the conference call they ignored tough questions. I don't see how this quarter can get any better. They no longer have sales growth of 40% to 50% to wow people. They will be lucky to get 25% this quarter and most likely another loss. It can't go on forever...if you are old enough to remember the Iomega's and Yahoo's of the world.

Topic.Title: PE on its way to 2000

Message.Msg: I have not heard that AMZN had a blowout holiday shipment. BBY reported an increase in online sales of 4-6% in areas where AMZN collects sales tax: California, Texas, Pennsylvania. All of those states are very populous states and represent large markets. What this shows is that BBY and other retailers can go toe-to-toe with AMZN once the tax advantage is gone. AMZN is not smarter than other retailers, but rather they have been riding on an unfair tax advantage.

Topic.Title: AMZN unfair advantage ending

Message.Msg: This year, I bought my camera from Ebay/buydig. Why? It was actually cheaper than AMZN even without tax. Topping the deal off, Ebay/buydig did not add tax whereas had to add tax on a higher base price. My own observations on AMZN pricing (general electronics) is that they are not competitive this year even taking out the tax. We also got a new tablet from BBY. In years past, AMZN would have been the place for both the camera and the tablet.

Message.Msg: I doubt AMZN will go below 200 unless there is a catalyst in the form of slowing revenues. Bezos is flailing widely trying to find new revenue sources to outrun the falling core revenues. I don't think he will be successful without a 8-10% unfair tax advantage, which is ending.

Message.Title: Amazon to da moon!
Message.Msg: I guess I've been wrong all along. Amazon must be about to generate insane cash flow because the price keeps going up and that makes it so...

Topic.Title: AMZN unfair advantage ending

Message.Msg: 3P sales grew 40%. That huge. That said, what's the base of 3P sales? And, 3P don't sell exclusively on AMZN. They sell on Ebay, WMT, TGT, SHLD, BBY, NewEgg, etc...you name it, they sell it. On a revenue growth basis, not sure 3P sales will make it up for core AMZN revenues falling. Also, I figure AMZN revenue from 3P sales would be only the portion 3P pays AMZN for Fullfilment by Amazon (FBA) ? That's a small percentage of the actual dolllar amount.

Topic.Title: Question - when hasn't AMZN sold off on earnings?

Message.Msg: I don;t think it will happen that fast - too much is on the line for the investment banks/analyts and hedgies - they won;t give up that quickly. This could take 3-4 more earnings seasons before reality of the business model sinks in, that this stock is not worth 70x 2014 earnings at the start of 2013 (long after we should have seen all investments pay off). 15 years of operations and over $250B in revenues, yet only $2B total in retained earnings to show for it. What a cash generator.

Topic.Title: Question - when hasn't AMZN sold off on earnings?

Message.Msg: If there is a hint of slowing revenue growth, it will drop fast, real fast. Watch last week of December. AMZN hit low 240 (even sub 240) due to reports that Holiday sales in general was slow. There needs to be a catalyst for AMZN to blow up and that catalyst is a slowing revenue growth.

Topic.Title: AMZN unfair advantage ending

Message.Msg: You mean 3P has no sales tax? Well, AMZN has been lobbying (a reverse in policy position) to impose sales tax uniformly everywhere. Why did AMZN reverse their position? AMZN knows they cannot compete with captive and non-captive 3P with 3P don't have to charge sales tax. Well, AMZN had had to collect sales tax in California, Texas, and Pennsylvania for a little while now, and BBY just reported that their online sales in those states went up 4-6%. The strategic picture is changing and it is not in favor of AMZN.

Topic.Title: AMZN unfair advantage ending

Message.Msg: Good post, unfortunately none of the longs have intelligent posts on this board. This stock is currently the biggest bubble ever created in the market. $120 billion commpany with forward PE of 150. A $120 billion company would be a bubble even if it had forward PE of 50, let alone 150. Plus none of that forward Earning estimates have been met by AMZN, for the last few years, every year the analysts pump the earnings, and AMZN has not been able to meet those earnings estimates. So probably current forward PE is 300.

Topic.Title: AMZN unfair advantage ending

Message.Msg: I agree with you... PE isn't everything. That being said, any business that sports a 3000+ pe ratio has to execute to perfection it justify such a lofty valuation. How's AMZN stack up? - amzn just lost an incredible competitive advantage. a 5% to 7% sales tax advantage drives behavior. i've, along with many other people, bought stuff on amzn just because the sale tax advantage. that's gone. - have you looked at the fundamentals??? decelerating sales growth, declining operating and net margins - their free cash flow is poor quality. last night an insightful article came out about amzn's free cash flow. ask yourself how they can generate the high free cash flow when they have such poor earnings. they play games... that's how. i could go on. there are many reasons to short amzn besides pe.

Topic.Title: Just re-read the Credit Suisse Report from October - what a good laugh!

Message.Msg: My point was that even an in upside majestical forecast from credit suise, it will take them 7 years to earn what apples earns in 1. This guy had $11 of EPS in 2017 ... it could be, who the F knows ... but even if you beleive that, how do you pay 30x 2017 EPS in your price target???? what a joke! You need to discount that $11 to todays $, if you apply a P/E of 30 in 2017, discount back by 30% per year. That $11.14 becomes $3.90 in 2013$, x30 multiple (3x apple) = $117. that is a little more like it.

Message.Title: Smartest Traders
Message.Msg: Think a market pull back of 15 percent is coming soon. Match this with another low profit quarterly report and you can knockoff 50 bucks in a week here. The last 3 earnings reports tanked the thing in after hours only to recover and rocket in the premarket. The next time it tanks the traders will let you think the same thing will happen. We are way over due for a surprise to the down side with no rally back. The easy way to fool the masses is to make them think the same thing will happen 4 times in a row. Sounds like the perfect set up to short into a drop NOT buy into it. Bet the smart is going to change the game just when you think you have it figured out. Air pocket followed by a crash. NOT even remotely possible we have been conditioned to think. Hum let's see......
